YrcGNeHz21qosj_hlS6HOw.text: When you call yourself the king of gyros you are setting a high bar for yourself before somebody even steps in the door. However this spot makes a gyro that while not locking up the title of King clearly it certainly has a solid claim to the throne.  I came here late on a Saturday afternoon with my girlfriend for lunch and we were both pretty hungry so we went with the combo's with greek salad's. For $16 we got 2 filled to the brim with meat gyros, 2 salads, and 2 sodas.   There isn't much to say about the salad, it's a greek salad with the usual fixings but what stood out was the peppers, cucumber and tomato all tasted fresh. Salads had a good mix of peppers, onions, cucumber and tomato so nothing dominated. Feta and dressing were standard fare.  The gyro's stood out. I got the fireman's gyro which is a standard gyro with giardiniera peppers (a nod to the heavy Chicago roots of this place). The first thing I noticed when presented with the gyro was just how much meat it had in it (having been freshly shaved to order from the spit). This thing was loaded with meat. The next thing was that the tzatziki was a thicker heavier version than the more smooth salad dressing kind most places, this was more of a spread or dip. It had great dill flavor and really complimented the meat. When taking a bite of this the flavors of the juicy meat with the spicy giardiniera and refreshing cooling flavors of the tzatziki was just perfect.  The place was clean and the staff friendly and personable. I also liked being able to see into the prep area with the spinning spits of chicken and gyro meat, it made my mouth water from the moment I walked in seeing the delicious and juicy meats. Watching them shave the gyro meat to order was a great way to showcase the freshness.  The bottom line was the gyro was very tasty and filling with a ton of meat for a great price. Both my girlfriend and I were so fully we ended up only needing a light dinner late. There are some other good gyro places that may be a bit more authentic to the middle eastern style but the King of Gyros is easily in contention for the Iron Throne of Gyros.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lot of food for $16 (including drinks).

I asked for no tomato and received: no tomato, no onion and a dab of tzatziki.   The side greek salad was okay, so long as you didn't want much more than lettuce. I did have a bite of a friend's chicken souvlaki and that tasted pretty good, but I won't be going there for their "gyros" sandwiches.

5jptx8waaF5p0-LMIq9H6Q.text: Currently eating as I swipe this on my phone and I understand the 5 star rating. The place is very clean, and inviting. It has a hip, city feel to it unlike other gyro places that are in need of an update. I feel like I'm back in Cali or Seattle. Prices are pretty on point so not much to say there. The staff is very friendly and easy going.  So the food... The gyro is really wonderful!! The tzatziki sauce is fantastic. Layered under the shaved meat is onions and sliced tomato. Really delicious. However, my only criticism are the fries. They're very much an after thought. No seasoning, thick starchy pieces of potato. So 4 stars. 9AXlXNlMkmZwKzN7smIsRg.text: Long overdue update: King of Gyros (KOG) is as good as it gets IMHO for fast casual Greek food; when out and about KOG is always my pick for tasty, healthy choices served up by friendly folks who treat customers like royalty! Even when I dropped my lunch in the car park yesterday, I knew it would be delicious as always, and it survived pretty much intact because they pack it well (I'm quite sure they would have replaced it, but my legendary clumsiness is no need to waste food:)   Favorite menu items: chicken Souvlaki platter - a generous portion of marinated, grilled poultry - with their smooth and tangy hummus, and refreshing Greek Salad; the falafel which is never greasy sporting a pillowy, well seasoned interior; the dolmades adorned with quality olive oil and a bright lemon splash which brings those delicate grape leaves to life; and finally the lentil soup which I eat whenever I can, the spices add a warmth and depth I crave; their hot, fluffy pita is a perfect accompaniment. Scott thoroughly enjoys the gyros which are carved to order from a proper spit and is a fan of both the rice and fries, the aforementioned Greek salad and dolmades: he worked for years in a Greek diner in NY and is therefore picky about this cuisine, and loves it.   KOG is family owned and operated, service is always with a smile, so welcoming. The kitchen is open, so you can watch your food being prepared, the dining area is clean, they offer beer, wine, soft drinks (bottles and fountain) and unsweetened fresh brewed iced tea which I love. At lunchtime they are very busy with local workers chowing down on reasonably priced and quick, delicious eats; ordering in advance can save some time.   Wish: Avgolemono soup (I have been lobbying for them to make it for a year, but can't resist their bomb lentil soup!)   Long live the King!!!  * 10% off first Yelp check-in  * tasty baklava  * closed Sunday  * order ahead online - you can use Yelp! app - or via phone @ lunch if you are in a hurry  * reasonably priced for quality ingredients

TSkPNWpw_5LCbE4TcTdQng.text: I have dined here three times.  The high reviews brought me here and brought me back again to ensure I didn't miss something.  I guess Greek Fast Casual (GFC) is the current trend based on the number of higher rated reviews on Yelp across The Valley.    I have taken the time to eat at four other highly rated GFC restaurants in the East Valley and I have found a common denominator: Kronos Meats.  Kronos is a 40-year-old company that produces Gyros meat and other products like Tzatziki Sauce and Hummus.  That said, there is a benefit in using premade meat: consistency.  The taste of each product served at most GFCs is very similar because of the use of Kronos products; if it doesn't taste good it can usually be attributed to overcooking the meat, or over-heating the pre-sliced meat.  Therefore, if you have an amazing Gyro or Kabob pita, it is probably because of proper preparation and handling; often, it is because of cutting corners such as using pre-sliced meat or pre-slicing the meat and keeping it in the warmer.  Not that is what I saw here at the King of Gyros, but I digress.    The Beef and Beef/Lamb Options were tasty and moist; the best of which I experienced was the pork.  The portions are above average at King of Gyros compared to other GFCs, this includes being a bit heavy handed on the Feta Cheese used on multiple products as well as the "Dressing" on the Greek Fries.  Greek Fries are relatively straightforward: garlic, Feta, seasoning (olive oil, etc.) and salt atop French-fried potatoes, it is not too hard to get right, and when each component is in the proper proportion to the others, Greek Fries are amazing!  Unfortunately, The King does not get this right, the fries are swimming in what is best described as salad dressing, it is just not palatable (see posted photos).  The salads offered are also generous on the portions, however, they seem to suffer from the same overdressing as the fries.  Which is a shame because the product quality seems on the high side but it just cannot stand up to the barrage of oil & vinegar.  Another issue I, and my dining partners, experienced is some inconsistencies of the cook of meat.  On one visit, the Chicken Shawarma was moist and tender on a salad, yet dry and chewy on a pita, really? How did they do that?  I do appreciate the relatively quick service, even when it is busy.  I like that there is a drink tower and real brewed iced tea is offered; Pepsi fans will also be happy with the fountain selections.  On my first visit, the pictorial menu board proved tricky because of the close spacing between products and the placement of the description and price below the photo and the menu number above caused me to order a number seven when I thought I was ordering what was really a number four.  This happened again to a dining companion on another visit.  Perhaps a reprogramming is in order because the cashier admitted it happens often; not the worst thing, but a menu should be clear and concise as well as illustrative.  Overall, The King of Gyros is a solid 3.5 stars.  The food is good, the service is sufficient the prices are on par with the competition, but there is nothing that I experienced or ate that was memorable or would make me become a regular.  If you are in the area and you have a taste for Greek, The King of Gyros will fit the bill, but I have found other places that are worth the drive and are tastier.  Overall rating: 3.5 Quality: 3.6 Service: 3.6 Cleanliness: 3.4 Value: 3.2 Atmosphere: 3

GxpsToazA83_t9_-ncZlrw.text: Enjoy King sized portions of meat for prices reasonable enough for a serf. There are quite a few meats and a few vegetarian options for both plates and pita sandwiches, with a combo option that includes a drink and soda or salad. I went with the #7 chicken shawarma pita combo with fries. It came out in a few minutes, filled to the brim with marinated chicken breast, onion, mixed greens, tomato, and a hearty layer of tzatziki sauce. The chicken was tender and the vegetables fresh with a soft, warm, fluffy textured pita. It was so big it wouldn't really fit in the "Gyro" paper sandwich holder that came with it.  The fries were crinkle cut and were cooked well. There is a soda fountain with Pepsi products, Dr. Pepper, diet Dr. Pepper, and various iced teas to the side.   The interior is spacious with high ceilings and a dark grey/black theme. The tables are nice with granite countertops.  The total for the pita combo was a little less than $10.  Service at the counter was decent, not super friendly but hey what do you expect from a fast food place.  I'll be back for more delicious pitas and plates!

jh7UK-OQTEquGeq4djmfzg.text: I have loved falafel pitas as long as I can remember & wanted a simple familiar dish. Thinking a falafel might me light lunch fair I stopped in with my 3 daughters.   I ordered the falafel pita combo & chose a Greek salad instead of fries. My older daughters ordered the kids hot dog & chicken strips.   When the food was finished the servings were quite large. Full size hot dog & 3 large piping hot chicken strips for the kids. Both came with a reasonable serving of crinkle cut fries. The Greek salad was large enough to make a light meal out of by itself. Lots of dark green lettuces, cucumber slices, & too few tomatoes. Topped with Feta crumbles & a bit too much dressing (definitely ordering light on the dressing or on the side next time) and a single un-pitted black olive (it deserved friends). The falafel was stuffed with some unexpected ingredients including herbed & roasted broccoli, sugar snap peas, & onions. I prefer green falafel to the fresh fried red variety they serve with a distinctly Indian flavor but it was very well made. I most missed Tahini sauce which I usually order extra but doesn't appear on their version of falafel at all probably because it wouldn't complement the veggies as well.   Overall we all will return to try more of their bargain priced menu.

I love the Chicago theme they have!

Ph3Qg6r3cRkMl73fTOOQvw.text: The place is very clean and nice inside but the french fries weren't done enough they were very mushy. For my taste I could have used a bit more tzatziki sauce. Overall experience wasn't bad but wasn't great so I'll give them a 3.

LDnxQ_UMe7Uqx7Jxd3P3IA.text: The food was delicious-I ordered the gyro plate with rice and substituted the salad for hummus. Price was awesome for what you're getting and they had great service, the guy at the register was really nice. Will definitely be returning.

Eml_nnbmkql-dJCFuUW0dw.text: My boyfriend and I love this place!! The food is delicious , the place is casual and clean , staff is very nice ! We love the chicken schawarma plate, but everything I've had is good!

7BkIh9faegWPznD-3vJPhw.text: Best gyro in town! Best menu, great service.  Dennis is the man!  Great Mediterranean and Greek food.

NpqlYhgg1plEkc562-LTzA.text: King of Gyros is the best gyro spot in the valley.  Their meats are phenomenal, the salads are fresh (their house dressing is delicious) and the restaurant is always clean.  I highly recommend trying it out if you're in the area!

IRMAP-XGY6Va_aRh033KZQ.text: I finally found the best gyros in Arizona after 10 years of looking, thank god!!! Amazing food!!

yynU-fCw-iJnVbPBXVh_zQ.text: The food was really good. I highly recommend the pico gyro with fries. I came with my family, which includes a little one, and we had happy campers all around. The prices are very reasonable and the staff was friendly. Plus, the wait time for the food was pretty fast, despite coming during a lunch rush. Make sure to try the orange sauce at the tables. It's some sort of buffalo sauce that's absolutely banging.

tTJqDZGjW5HoOKlwkoVVhg.text: I ordered the Gyro's plate.    Good food, and good value for the price.  But where are the tomatoes and onions that were supposed to come with this plate??

_3_9CooWuT_VY8pGrvn3aA.text: Great greek salad, it was fresh and chicken was tasty. Very friendly,  great customer service.  Had to order a to go after seeing another customer's order. Which was delicious! Can't wait to return to try other dishes!

yY1GLcHTS6rHUh0hMRdcBw.text: Love, love, love King of Gyros! Was doing some work in Chandler and said to myself "Self... Sure could go for a Greek Salad with grilled chicken today!" But where to go, where to go?  Turned to my trusty Yelp! app and found King of Gyros. Not certain how this place doesn't have 5-stars (What's up Yelpers in Phoenix?), but decided to give it a shot.  The line was short, the service was fantastic, and the salad... Heavenly! Best part... No Romaine lettuce so no salmonella poisoning for me!!   Here's the rundown:  Satisfied? Yes Return? Yes Advocate? Yes

sEgtJauxi8r7B_yhIGK7HQ.text: First time trying this place at lunch on a Wednesday. Place was packed! Which is a great sign! But if you only have a half hour lunch or are in a rush I highly recommend calling in your order and take it to go. Every table was taken and as soon as anyone got up the table was quickly occupied. It is a really small place so if you don't like being in a crowded place don't eat here at lunch during the week. Now, the food was delicious! I added feta to my pita wrap and I felt there should have been more but still very good. The sauce was delicious and i wish there was more of that too but still tasted great! The chicken was marinated and tender. Pita was soft and delicious! I will definitely be back.

4gv5ZLJ4LWYEF-t-39Z90w.text: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME!  This place is great.  The food comes out warm and flavorful. We ordered a gyro salad, kabobs, jalapenos poppers and gyro sandwich.   The salad was delicious but I would suggest to order extra sauce with it.  The kabobs were tender and flavorful.  The poppers were hot and fresh from the fryer.  (Frozen premade  poppers).  The fries and crinkle cut and crispy.  The Gyro sandwich was good as it comes with lots of meat.  I would suggest to ask for extra sauce as well.  Plus the tomato is put on the pita first so the hot meat will make it soft and mushy.  I didn't mind but you may have a different preference.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gyro sandwich combo.  I know it looks like a lot of sauce but trust me..they load it with meat so ask for extra sauce on the side.
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jalapeno poppers

nNYbcey1GAfx5fJCSMKWsA.text: I got the combination platter here after I couldn't decide between the chicken shawarma and the gyro. Unfortunately the chicken shawarma looked a lot tastier than it actually was as it was fairly tough. I would recommend not asking for a salad as your side dish since all of the plates come with a salad already. The gyro meat itself was pretty good and they definitely give you a large portion of food here for how much it costs!   This is an above average Mediterranean place but still falls short to the likes of hajji baba in Tempe! I definitely wouldn't mind coming here again though.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States

pZXsvADezA-45DGpfp-f2g.text: Never a fan of Mediterranean cuisine, yet I'll try it often hoping I might change my opinion.   Mah.. Ordered falafel pita - not a great taste but green sauce was awesome. Falafels were bland. Personally not a fan of restaurants that expect tips before serving. King of gyros is one among them.  Decent ambience. Good for a one time visit.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States

54b7eb5tX7hCWfO_9VM0RQ.text: This has been my go to Chicago style gyros, hot dog, and shawarma place here in the East Valley for a while. It's not that other shops are bad, it's that this one is easier to get to for me and the food is great. You can get an Iltaco pizza puff here, you can get a red hot dragged through the garden, and the combo shawarma/kefta/meat rice and salad plates are great. The service has always been fantastic, and there's that wall length mural of the downtown skyline looking west from Grant Park. Can't beat that.

JdwFJMjZcZ0TTXX54NEgSg.text: I came at the suggestion of a coworker. My other go-to Greek spot changed ownership a while back and I guess the old owner took the recipes and good employees.   I got the #1, regular gyro. The meat was tender and well seasoned. The pita was soft and fresh.   It was a good experience except for the angry old man who works there. He yelled at my husband for holding the door open for me! Grandpa must have been worried about the A/C bill. I guess there's no place for chivalry at King of Gyros.   The food was good, but I don't care for the rude employees. Greek spots are a dime a dozen out here. They should treat customers with a little more consideration.

k_6hMO1Pe_38SeotlZHhGQ.text: Tonight's Firefighter Gyro was perfect! If you like gyro meat, beef, and spicy peppers then you must give the Firefighter a try. It's the best thing on the menu IMO.

JyKn9qvSOwCt3qywkvHf7g.text: Went there for lunch today, after many good visits.  Gyro had no sauce on it today and the hummus was made with what tasted like used fryer oil, instead of EVOO. Fries are good.  Think I'm done here after frequent visits over the last year.

pImN0yoXf0QjIQQ-uoGaUg.text: Oh My word...I saw this place and another and so, I had to try them both this evening.  Gluttonous...??  Why yes...it was.  Was it worth it?  Absolutely!  This was hands down the best Gyro I've had outside of Detroit...and trust me, I've "tried" a S**T-Ton in every state north and west of New Mexico.  It's funny the simplicity of a Gyro...you think you've found a good one until you FINALLY find a really-really F-ing good one!  Picture to come...crazy huge but more importantly, crazy-crazy delicious!!!!    Enjoy Chandler - you bastards!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seriously??  Huge, just frigg&#39;en huge.  But more importantly - absolutely delicious. Best Gyro  I&#39;ve had in the SW I swear.

Y9WZa3PNB_HGnluDVbGalg.text: Very good food , soup was delicious, gyro very yummy first time was great second try wasn't so good .. too bad , I really thought I found my favorite restaurant in this category

I1mO_R32JN27msDo_Zuimw.text: This might be my new go-to gyro place! I've been to several Mediterranean restaurants in the area for lunch and this one is my favorite for gyros. I had the basic gyro combo meal with fries and a drink (side salad is available instead of fries for the same price). The fries and soda are just about the same as you can find anywhere but not bad. The gyro stands out because it comes on a nice thick piece of pita bread and is loaded with meat. The sauce really makes it with a decent garlic punch to the face. They don't overload the gyro with sauce and veggies. For under $10 you'll be stuffed. The restaurant is pretty clean even after the lunch rush. The only thing that I struggled with was the cheap napkins. You can have all the napkins you need but they don't work that well. Don't let a bad napkin stop you from enjoying a great lunch though. I'll be back to try more menu items.

7z6U3kfjXedCmUt19LS4lQ.text: I placed an order for lunch through Grubb Hub via Yelp. It gave me about a 30 minute time frame for my order to be ready. I thought that sounded kind of long for just a gyro. So, I arrived early and it was ready and waiting for me.  My gyro was packed with flavor! The meat was tender and seasoned perfectly. I will definitely be back to try other items.

m_abUILyvM-H9jTnIJveAA.text: Very clean and nice place. Ordered shawarma plate .person took order was nice. Good food

sdqXd6m6PIggM3gkHlVhww.text: King of Gyros has great food at great prices. Everything is authentic. Clean restaurant and friendly. Love this place

Lgm7w02cg1ikWHKgxfVXwQ.text: Excellent food at a good price! The chicken and beef souvlaki has a great marinade and you get a lot of it. It comes with a nice yoghurt dip, salad, pita bread and your option of hummus or rice, and a drink. I love the hummus! It's smooth and has great flavor. You get all of this for $11! I'm definitely a regular and usually call in advance for takeout.

jsx3ytKRTkMs_uGeE4Ju9g.text: The service was great but honestly I could not eat this meal. So much grease, it started to nauseate me. Great portion sizes for the price but I'm going to stick with Niros.

B5r9ffwBUdb88KsuXW3Pew.text: Great Greek and Mediterranean food in a clean and modern setting. Dive quality food (and I mean that in the best possible way) in a nice upscale environment, but still reasonable prices.  Gyro salad was particularly good with tons of tasty Gyro meat, and the chicken Gyro was also excellent as well. I don't want to discount anything else because it was all great, but the best thing might have been the hot sauce, I put it on everything!  Owner was a nice friendly guy, took time to talk to us for awhile but wouldn't divulge his secret ingredient, other than they make everything from scratch there, other than the Gyro meat, which they buy from his hometown of Chicago.

AMnCXFuhYWGeCWW53jSf0A.text: Very good customer service, the quality of the food was very good, the restaurant very clean and that include the restroom.

m7cscEubYa3qveFt184jYA.text: This is great food. The meat is flavorful and the vegetables are very fresh. Service is great too!

qG7rHJ2Jw8H_xEXF6NVM-g.text: Good gyro.  There was enough meat that I either had to eat it with a fork or wear it.  Side salad was good with a nice mix of veg.  For the amount of food, price was more than reasonable.

c-V6_Fg7Jwg6OGLz63ec5A.text: Talk about AMAZING Greek food. The chicken gyro was amazing, the hummus is to die for, and the salad as a side was delicious. Proportions are extremely fair sized and the price isn't bad at all for the amount of food. I will definitely be back soon!

e2epXsHCRLyweEsw87klQg.text: Saw the reviews, and thought we would try it out. Food was fabulous. Chicken shawarma and Greek fries absolutely delicious. Can't wait to go back.

VRJu_mNzIaiEr9ePS5JWIQ.text: This place is the bomb!   Best gyro since I was in Greece.  Found this place on yelp when we were shopping in the area.   A simple fast food type of place serving excellent gyros.

HQVdtR9zt4scgkt3xM3zfw.text: Best gyros! Best tzatziki sauce! Best pita! Definitely a must. The food is full of flavor, fresh and delicious. It's our new favorite.

zfl94i5cWO90FGc3z6URyQ.text: So good, so quick, generous portion sizes, fairly priced, and they move you quickly even during busy lunchtime.

fxxxezRi4-BmRcCuKhOD4g.text: Phenomenal gyros  The meat was so tender and the pita was fresh! I will definitely be back here, I agree it was one of the best gyros I have had

SaGa2QiWjk5NZPX9f682kQ.text: AMAZING!!! Not only is the food tasty and fresh but for the price, you get a lot of food. The staff is very friendly and go above and beyond. I've had the chicken shawarma with both the hummus and the tabouli. I dare say it's better than Pita Jungle!

soxyht_SkmMsm7nvP4wcBg.text: One of the best Mediterranean food in Tempe and Chandler  Friendly staff, Love this place.

iLrM6Kh5YNMj8yRbUa2uZg.text: This is one of the better Greek places I have eaten at. They are all super friendly and the food is delicious. The gyro meat had lots of flavor and they are very generous portions. I want to come back and try some of the other options.

Y1PZ3DkcKOjTajQxhF8VlA.text: Totally impressed with the food here...everything we ate was wonderful. I honestly can say the best gyro I've ever had. More than recommend this for a quick and delicious meal.

5O8rQr35w11HMkJrv30gbg.text: You get a huge portion of food for your $. The 9.50 gyro plate gets you a ton of meat, pita, hummus, tzatziki sauce, and salad and drink. I'm so full. Staff is super friendly and restaurant is very clean. Will be back many times.

nX_UeyNY1mzKmj4GavMXTw.text: This place was fantastic; not only is their food great, but you really can't beat the price for meat of this quality especially considering the quantity you get.

4LmjMWvvSEqTcfhmSxIWSw.text: Absolutely amazing!   Real Greeks cooking real Greek food.   I mean they even asked how I want my meat cooked...  Never experienced that at a gyro joint.   Will be going back..  Many more times.

MwOCJ_TChPuJUs4-3K8QoQ.text: Have to go along with most of the other reviews, hands down best gyro ever!! The meat was so flavorful & tender, amazing sauce and a great pita. Also staff is very friendly. Loved the Chicago memorabilia reminds me of home. Go there hungry!!

DYmRDUAqeblzYmsNO4VN4A.text: It was jam packed at noon. Lots of business pants in here! People clearly like this place. I ordered a gyro combo. The salad was exceptional and gyro was delicious. Best tzatziki I've ever had. Dill!!! Seating was limited and it took about ten or twelve min to get food during the rush. Five stars after a return visit for consistency points.

ije21s5eUqtl3z2MudVfjg.text: Super nice people. Love the lentil soup. Big portions. Food is always great. Love the steak fries. Lunch time is pretty busy, its a good sign. Definitely enjoy the Chicago background and charm of the place. Tiny bit small and its fun maneuvering around the soda machine.

kTsIBfhliIXRloi3sAiQSA.text: Its does not matter when I go here the staff are friendly, the food is fresh and tasty whether I eat their or get carry out The food is consistent.  Thanks !!!

rn8cZg8SZk8UiOiEIqgbMw.text: I've eaten here a few times and it is great food. The menu is bigger than the gyro places I've been to in the past and the price is reasonable.   I suggest beating the lunch rush by coming early, noon this place is typically packed.

pg7JXtzC_4k8-orRM_oAlQ.text: The King of Gyros has some backing to the name. The food was fresh and delicious. You order your food at the register (the menu above the register feels like it's up in the sky by the way; it's way up there!) and then sit down in the fairly spacious dining area. The workers were polite and looked like they enjoyed helping you. A big plus!   We ordered the gyro wrap with fries and a salad. The gyro meat was flavorful and well cooked. The cool, fresh veggies were nestled in the pita, and it was all topped with perhaps the best gyro sauce I've had. It was a little darker than typical "Tzatziki" sauce, so I won't call it that just in case it is something different.   I have to knock off 2 stars though (I stopped myself from giving them a 2 star rating), and here is why. While we were eating, an employee was mopping the dining room and the smell was overwhelming. It literally felt like we were eating in the restroom. It was a "good" smell if you like cleaners, but it's not something you want while trying to enjoy your food. I would HIGHLY recommend the restaurant to mop during after-hours. The place wasn't that dirty to be mopping while people are eating anyway. And I didn't feel the restaurant was that much cleaner after mopping. All it did was ruin our food experience.   But the food is great from what I could taste in the midst of the mopping bucket aroma. Next time, I may try some take-out, or eat outside.

9rKDe3vEscmvVKILVeLiFw.text: My first experience with Greek food, and it was amazing! I had their steak shawirma gyro as well as some hummus and pita. It's a fairly small place and it's always very full, maybe because I always go on my lunch break right at noon. I don't have any complaints honestly. Good customer service, cashier helped me decide on what to get because I was so new to Greek food and gyros.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seating area

E1q2qS0NgA-8RrElvY7dqw.text: I don't even attempt to find another gyro spot in the area because this one hits the spot all the time!  The pita is nice and soft, the gyro meat is thinly shaved and abundant. Their tzatziki is well seasoned and tastes like they make in store.   There's a group of 3-4 men who are cooking the orders (looks to be all family members) So it's a great spot for a quick lunch.   Try this place out- you won't be disappointed! Even if there's a few people ahead of you, they will make your order fast and tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gyro with grilled onions, tomatoes, and sauce
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t beat these prices!

tYTU4HzMQEdm66V472lvqA.text: Love this place! Why?  Atmosphere: very Chicago like. Smart and comfortable layout, holds a lot of people, really cool memorabilia on the walls, lots of natural light and one entire wall is the Chicago skyline, really well done! It's comfortable and easy to navigate self-ordering, drinks and eating here. Be warned, it's so good that it can get really crowded, I hope you don't mind sharing a table with a friendly stranger or two, because it can get busy and there's good reason for it.  Service: Aamir and his wife, the owners, are extremely friendly, social, talkative and genuinely care about your satisfaction, to a fault. Other employees are nice, but you'll definitely know when you're talking with Aamir, he is immediately like a family member that you love to hang out with, always has a smile, a story and is genuinely appreciative of your patronage.  Food: The food is always fresh and tasty, relatively good portions and authentic. Aamir is extremely proud of his lentil soup and he should be, it's phenomenal! Everything we've eaten here has been excellent. They offer a spicy Shawarma that I've never had before and it's excellent. Value is decent, it's not inexpensive, not crazy expensive, worth it.  Do I recommend King of Gyros? Absolutely! It is our new, "go to" Mediterranean restaurant. Always feels comfortable with reliable service and great quality food. Try it, you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. The whole place, comfy and homey.

K3aY0ukFpi6KwMdmJ2PVvg.text: I've had a chance now to try both their side of gyro and side of chicken kabob plates (I was on the keto diet ), and both were of very high quality, generous portions, and at reasonable prices. The look of the place is pleasant and kept clean, and the staff seem friendly, namely the on-shift manager/owner/cashier, based on our few short interactions. I will definitely come back when in the neighborhood!

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Savory side of chicken kabob.
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States

hwVFCRQCjhzR5BsNnKoEYA.text: Amazing little Mediterranean place, just amazing, I have tried almost everything hear and nothing disappoints I don't like salads very much but the Greek salad here is so good. Best gyro and souvlaki I have ever had at a restaurant. You will not go wrong with anything on the menu here. My favorite is the gyro plate but everything is awesome. Veggie combo plate is excellent to.

wEd8OVHK0pi0loEIA_YtWw.text: AMAZINGGGGGG!!! So yummy, food was fresh, meat was seasoned, more than enough gyro meet. Wow I'd recommend to anybody who is looking for a GREAT QUALITY GYRO!!!

4644j2KzvQLRycZYVCOImQ.text: Not too many places in the valley make a rotisserie gyro but the King of Gyros would definitely fall in my top 10 spots for a good quantity of sandwich.  This time around we ordered the gyro sandwichs and made a meal with french fries and a soft drink. Also got a Greek salad and chicken pita sandwich.  The wait wasn't so long but they had a steady flow of people coming in an out (not too busy for a weeknight). When the food arrived I was happy with the large portion sandwich. The pieces of gyro were stacked almost to the point where you couldn't fold them over without the pita bread breaking in half. Definitely needed a fork as you were going to have some toppings fall out (and that's a good thing)  The salad was decent but a little too much dressing. Part of it was the presentation as it is served on a paper plate. Plenty of salad, but need to find something else vs a paper plate. The only thing keeping this place from a higher rating was the fries. This time around I was disappointed as the fries were overcooked & came out lukewarm. Not sure if they were cooked earlier and then recooked, but wasn't a fan this time around.   Fountain drink selection is Pepsi & they only had a few choices along with a variety of teas (unsweetened and one Lipton Brisk).  I was looking for some strong carbonation to help close the deal but the Pepsi soda just didn't provide it for me this time around (kinda flat, or maybe that's just Pepsi vs other colas).  Looking forward to my next trip and hope the fries are on point like the sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States

_4PhQix8KKS2gY7qFR11DA.text: This place is dope!   So stinking delicious... if I could have every meal here, I totally would!   Great space, reminds me of walking in to Old Chicago. Super friendly owners. Hands down, the nicest couple I have met.   The food was as Greek as it gets. It was fresh, cooked perfectly and heaven in my mouth. Highly recommend the Fire Fighter if you like spicy food.   Greek fries... yup.. get those too..   You won't go wrong stopping by here. Even just to sit and chat with the nice people and grab a cold beer.

axnuA9-vgm_94nylAFnKYA.text: We were in the neighborhood after an Ikea trip and were running down the list of nearby places to eat. Greek food sounded good but I'm always apprehensive about any business who crowns themselves with a self-proclaimed title like "king of ...", I think it's up to me to decide if they earn such a title, not the business owner.  Ok, let's cut right to it, this modest strip mall place is all that and maybe even more.  They've got the look of a business who's serious about food - no minimum wage entry level hash slingers in sight, but rather several guys who look like they know what Greek food is supposed to taste like.  Our only contact was with the cashier (the guys were working their tails off in the kitchen) and she was friendly and efficient.  The depth of the menu is impressive, more choices than expected.  Serving sizes for the price were also impressive.  But where they really shine is flavor. If you like your meat to be tender but with a smoky crispy charbroil to it, you will love this place.  There are a lot of similar restaurants in "the Valley" and I've been to a lot of them, and so far King of Gyros is one of the best.  We took our order to go so I could only take a quick glance at the dining room, but it looks casual and friendly and a good place to hang out with friends.  There's only one thing that I would suggest they consider - if you order a dinner plate it includes a fountain drink whether you want one or not, there's no credit if you don't want the drink.  That doesn't always work out so well for people who order their meal to go, which seems to be a fairly high percentage of their customers.  I'm not complaining a lot because none on the dinner meals were very expensive to start with and the cashier kindly offered to let us take a bottle water from the cooler in lieu of a fountain drink, and a bottle of water in the desert always comes in handy.  I like this place and will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Huge portions
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Impressive menu
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. These guys are serious about cooking

8_zAQyGEvnHotz7Q9nvNjg.text: This place is down right amazing and needs to open more locations. Authentic friendly and fast. I cannot say enough about the Hummus and lamb! This is a go to for Med food hands down.

loqenUVEv_zqA8dn-FwM3A.text: This is a busy place at lunch.  You order, pay and and wait for your order.  It was full inside, but they have a decent number of tables outside so that is where we sat.   They have six kinds of sefl-serve ice tea, so I was happy.  My wife ordered the Chicken Shawirma plate and I ordered the Steak Shawirma plate, though she had rice and I had hummus.  Interestingly they add a bit more salad if you order hummus.  The food was quite good and there was plenty of it.  We would come back.

kZtekJYykWSJlHdLWIiIxA.text: The chicken schwarma plate here is amazing!  You get a choice of soup or salad with it as well as either rice, hummus, or fries.  I chose the salad and hummus.  It also includes soft, piping hot triangles of pita bread.  The salad was a large portion with a delicious, bright, lemony dressing that I couldn't get enough of.  Their special tzatziki sauce was full of herb flavors and complimented the chicken perfectly.  The entire space was spotless.  The floors looked like they had just been mopped.  Everyone there was so nice and friendly.  I think they can safely call themselves the King of Gyros.  The title is very fitting.

ApGPQHWI2OygpwSHNpn6fw.text: Delicious food and very generous portions. I particularly like the chicken gyro, so yummy and just the right amount of feta.

34_KIjYDoH5YZ_g7ZtHX9g.text: Their gyro has to be one of the best in the valley!!   They service is always good and so are the prices. I've been here many times and ALWAYS get the gyro.  Their name King of Gyros is apropos!!

ZJMNTDfQZGLLw_oW-EcOYQ.text: I've never had a bad meal here. I usually get the fire fighter gyro and it's delicious. I've had it with salad before and with fries. I'm a picky fry person (who isn't?) and they have good ones. The side salad is good too. Make sure you ask for their special sauce when you go.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States

Gg4b7dSrwSn-SGCsV8UgoA.text: I first started coming here when I worked at the big Company that shares the parking lot. Many co-workers would rave about this place so of course I had to give it a shot (and they offer a 10% discount if you have a badge from that Company).  The Gyros, Shawarma and Chicago Dog are awesome. As are the greek fries and regular french fries. The crinkle fries are always hot, fresh and crispy. I can never resist the boxes of pistachio baklava sitting next to the cash register either.   This is a very affordable establishment to grab a quick bite. And fairly healthy! I love these family owned places.

SKqXd8mm4awBGzS84HTNbw.text: Thrilled this gem is just a skip and a hop from my new workplace! Stopped in for lunch around 11AM which was perfect because we hit the lunch rush! I'm not a huge salad person so I went with the gyro platter which ended up being perfect! Came with shreds of beef, a few onions and tomatoes, pita bread, rice hummus or fries, and then a side of soup or salad. Oh and a drink too! I went with rice and then a side of fries instead of the lentil soup or salad. Portion sizes were ginormous!! There was enough for me to bring home for dinner!! Food was delicious, came out quickly, and really hit the spot. Only complaint is that the rice had a slightly strange aftertaste that I wasn't too fond of, but I quickly got over that when I mixed it with the tzatziki sauce.

7nT9JfwMSicku7n6t8FQCA.text: The gyros were just ok.  Freshly cooked, nice huge portion of gyro meat, accompanied by a good-sized portion of perfectly cooked crinkly french fries.  I've had many a gyro pita sandwich in my life and for me, this was just average, and maybe even a little bit on the salty side and very stingy on the tzatziki.  On the plus side, the staff is friendly and helpful, and some of their other entrees looked appetizing.  Next time I am in the area, I might try the chicken shawarma.

qESE78Q81NANBpN0_CCY2Q.text: AZ is known for having some of the best middle eastern  food so when I saw this place right now next to my work I was excited to try it! I called in my order as soon as they opened at 10am and the guy who took my order was rude, didn't tell me how long it would take or anything. Once I got there the same guy who took my order came up rudely told me my total while being on his iPhone on a call. He continued to be on a phone call while I paid him and got my food and my drink and came back to work only to find a bad smell coming either the chicken or yellow rice, I ordered the chicken shawarma plate with rice and it had the kind of smell of food just beginning to go bad. I figured it was probably a smell of some spices they might've used so I started eating it. Conclusion: the chicken was under cooked and didn't taste anything like your typical chicken shawarma mixed in with some broccoli and green beans which is odd bc I don't think any Mediterranean place sells their chicken shawarma sauteed with broccoli, it tasted really bad. The rice was dripping with oil and gave me really bad heartburn. Needless to say I had to get pepto-b because I got sick from it. Ive been to places like haji baba princess and never tasted such weird Mediterranean food that was this bad, NOT SURE HOW THIS PLACE HAS 5 STARS The only thing nice about this restaurant is their huge painting.... Sadly I won't be going there for lunch every again!

3DJEIAicFiDkITPTO3jhvg.text: Awesome place. Super tasty food, and really great people working there--they're always really kind and quick. Last time I went in I was on my lunch break and was wearing my company ID, the gentleman behind the counter let me know that what I had ordered (something that is not my regular order) is actually the something  that takes the longest to cook, so if I was in a hurry he wanted to be sure I had a heads up on that.. (It was less than 10 mins). Very thoughtful gesture. If you are looking for excellent food provided by friendly faces, look no further.

F97L8z-T6vPCYVIkTtKT9Q.text: I have known this place since last year but never visit. Finally my husband and i decided to come here today. I did not expect this place until i had my first bite of chicken souvlaki. Oh my gosh!!  Best chicken souvlaki and kind price. Cant wait until my next visit here.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States

a0NadmRBg2EOVfb2DCrrvw.text: This place is fantastic, best Gyro I have had anywhere. I visit King probably 2 to 3 times a week. High recommend the #5 Firefighter style.

S4Yo5bFDxNVHdtGkxFheJg.text: I attended an event "Meet Me in the Mediterranean" and King of Gyros catered in the food. It was truly AMAZING (and I'm a picky eater)!! I enjoyed every bite. Definitely worth trying out!

P-zveSbUQpLnE9HOCLUTgA.text: Beef Schwarma pita was sooooo good. They use good cuts of beef! My sister got a chicken one, and it was a lil dry, but all the ingredients combined to create a delicious meal. Very impressed on my visit to this town. Service was quick too. The front door was a little heavy, but that is irrelevant to the review.

E63t91Kog7O1jCUAs7jqgg.text: Outstanding gyros, love this place. It is my Greek restaurant of choice when I'm in Tempe.

mIBndUZ44nB7M2HGYupYpw.text: This is by far the best gyro place, but don't be fooled into thinking that's all they have. The kefta is amazing and so is the chicken slouvaki!!! The rice is always perfectly cooked and delicious. Also, they now serve lentil soup. You wouldn't think lentil soup would be something to be excited about until you've had it here! So flavorful. The prices are more than fair considering you get a ton of food for what you pay. Everything is super clean and never dirty or messy. All of the employees are always helpful and gracious. The owner and his family are truly amazing and are willing to accommodate your order.  I love this place as does my entire family. We usually go at least twice a week; sometimes more. I highly recommend it! I only gave it 5 stars because that's the most it will allow or I'd give it a 10.

BHSLIoLXJQvCFXuYK1C7qA.text: One of a handful of places I've found in the east valley that serves Gyros like back in Chicagoland. Generous portion of meat carved from the rotisserie and served with onion, tomato and tzatziki sauce, not like some of the other joints out here that skimp on the meat and fill the pita up with lettuce. The Greek salad I had with the meal was very good as well. I'll definitely be back!

NbUt2tbmMTQP1BTEJn9QAw.text: Awesome! So well seasoned-- made to order fresh & hot! The best falafel I've ever had!

nbHcZWi_HjrSmqAqEJSwHg.text: Oh that delicious Greek Mediterranean culture food.  "For the Greeks!!" I absolutely love this place.  All of the food is great.  My favorite is the Chicken Solvaki salad or pita. Aka the "Man" salad.  My personal nickname because this salad could fill up an NFL offensive lineman.  Clean tender meat that is highly flavored. Decent priced.  Feta on everything.  Greek fries +3$ gyro meat is my cheat meal and is best of the best.  Fresh vegetables, rice, and humus.  I recommend this place to anyone who loves food of culture.  If not, there is an McDonalds down the street.

kDnZaKKbQt7TuUeJ5dy6pg.text: Excellent food! The manager reached out to me about my experience and invited me back to come try their food again. I had the Shwarma and it was great and flavorful. I highly recommend this place for your Greek fix. The customer service was awesome as well. Will b back.

xYdLaT6Dms7HWmQhA93jyg.text: I love Greek and I thought the prices were a little high for what I got. The falafel wasn't as good other places whose prices were cheaper for the side. Probably won't come back here again

2T0IV5MIgtyYUW4op0rPrw.text: Such a fantastic spot for healthy, delicious, quick Greek food. I come here often as its close to me and every time I'm pleased!

Ok6ngl4c0iJPnFzOPXVv2Q.text: Great food recommend to any one who loves good food, chicken is alright but everything is delicious. Crowded at lunch so get there early.. fast service

bANcISzyRSeK97o-I9Mj8Q.text: Slow service, but the food was great! My fiance and I both got a gyro special, and it was one of the best gyro plates I've had in America.

6qyxKlr7UU3bYKvV-OuC1w.text: This place is TBE. Everything is always fresh and super good, and at decent price. So happy I discovered this gem of a place. Don't eat any other Greek food trust me! You'll have to search high n low for a place that's as good as this one.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Taking a picture before its all gone

vzSt-c-lrl9JgyHzI7sTQQ.text: This place is great! Very authentic, family run business. Everyone here is so kind and welcoming. Their hummus is amazing. I always get their falafel plate. Some places make their falafel way too dry, but not here! And the portions are very generous. Definitely grateful to have King of Gyros so close to home! Highly recommend!

OfbY8o2DFZg3sKAQhNwXPQ.text: Been going here with the family for about a year now and we always see a bunch of returning customers. I love this place. The portions are good, prices are reasonable, and the food is delicious. I usually go with the chicken shawarma plate with hummus, pita, and salad. The staff here are always friendly and down to help with any special requests. If you're on the fence, go here. You won't regret it.

La-Mj69fdmW2_i7WUzkmsw.text: Love this place!!! I have been twice now with friends and it's now a new staple :) The food is fresh and authentic. Having been to Greece and enjoying the food there, I can def attest to this :) Thank you King of Gyros!

xr4PMipBahImX_sEe_ymag.text: That's my salad in the top picture!! The other 2 I pulled from actual customers on Yelp. I've been here a lot and never had a problem until today. I tried to call about my salad in the hopes of getting it replaced or a refund and I was shot down with " that's how the tomatoes are & we don't have red onions"! Jeez you would think they would try to resolve it seeing I spent $17 in there but no!!! Surprised & will not go out of my way to drive there again.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States

UWARd_-fx-OQUQMFgWU3OA.text: If you love a good Chicago Gyro, this is the place to go! We had the picado and fire fighter both were amazing. Next time we are adding a pizza puff to the order.

80FeejdIB-tsy3byRapd6Q.text: I live nearby and I feel very lucky to have this place so close to home! Best gyros in town!! Give them a try, you will love it!

U3WGk2a1SUw6T4jti8bAkA.text: Very good, fresh, quick meal. I had gyro Greek salad, wife had chicken Greek salad. Just a little too vinegar for me but wife said "that's Greek". Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Plenty of both meat and salad with fresh, fluffy pita on the side.

hySt79yjRayjpBUwkB04ZA.text: Delicious!  Ordered the lunch Gyro, salad and beverage. Reasonably priced, quick service, and good food.

7gtxecsEclrUBPrGV-XK_g.text: Stopped by for a quick bit, debating between this place and a sub place next door, boy am I glad we came here, their gyro sandwich was delicious, wrapped in fresh baked pita, and their service is great, very nice friendly workers there! Annnnnd to top it off they have Snapple!

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Those who have Snapple are always a winner in my book
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gyro

GJeQCWCuCLNp5HsvTcWAqw.text: Awesome Gyros and falafel. Great atmosphere, wonderful staff and always a happy crowd of people. This is our new go to spot!

N1hI9g7B1DvTJcV60_1ulw.text: My first visit. The gyro sandwich #1 with a salad. The place was clean, even the restroom was clean. The food was fresh and properly prepared. The flavors all popped like I expected from the Tzatziki sauce to the Tahini sauce and all the fresh greens. I'll be going back for sure.  The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgable when I asked about ingredients and how things were prepared. The Tzatziki BTW is made on site daily.  I remove my hat and take a knee, you have made a fan of me.

82ZGTgtKCXduYivWkUUtVw.text: This place is another... if not my go to place to order pick up.  Their food is absolutely amazing! The meats are seasoned to perfection....prices are reasonable and my favorite....a good ol mom and pop shop. The food exudes the owners love for their specialty. If your looking for some good mediterranean food....this is your place!

_NJDEci__8CHBxa7U1penA.text: Absolutely amazing Mediterranean/Greek food. The staff working were very welcoming and went out of their way to make my first visit a great one. The food was incredible. Everything was seasoned perfectly and cooked on point. I would have eaten an entire second plate if I could. I will definitely be going back on a regular basis.

gMEtzxAHyYFNOsvdzuc9xg.text: I don't know why the plates are more expensive if they have just as much/ if not less their regular pita with the exception of sides. Ordered the supreme plate and the steak and chicken were as burnt and dry as the desert... king of what again??????

I3l5OWj-SjPvpRZ-UW-GjQ.text: Got take out on a Saturday. This place is really clean, and everyone was very nice.  Had the falafel platter, and friend had the gyro platter, which was apparently very good (and I noticed had a ton of meat). I loved the falafel! At some restaurants, the falafel is so dry, but here they were moist and had really great flavor. SO nice to go somewhere where they are not treated like an afterthought! The side salads that come with the platters were mediocre - they were really fresh but the dressing was boring. But everything else was delicious! The platters are big enough for two meals; I had lunch the next day too.  Overall a great place, great value, excellent food! Will definitely be back.

QhSrelJJHGOluRzPretXqA.text: Got the gyro sandwich with all the toppings. This is the real deal. I should know being from Chicago and all! Lol. The gyro was just over $5, which I think is reasonable.  I didn't eat there,  but the to go service on  Saturday late morning was fast.  The dine in part looked very nice & clean.  Love the Chicago sky line on the wall. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gyro sandwich.  Yummy!
Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Best city ever!

qDMbjDLlOcqmawUcOVFvog.text: This spot was filled with hungry customers chowing down on a variety of pita sammies.  I ordered the Chicken Souvlaki combo with fries.  The chicken breast was very tasty-grilled to perfection and not dry.  I just wish there was more of it-rather lean on the chicken portions.  I am used to the bountiful Chicken sammie @ Greek Wraps-just spoiled I guess.  The fries were plentiful-just needed to be crispier.  They add a yummy sauce for your meal-a nice touch.

o8sPLRULx-uh3qspGKYETQ.text: I work nearby office and come often to King of Gyros. Every time, I enjoy the food here. Very fresh, well marinated & cooked meat and tastes very good. They serve good quantity as well. Gyros Hummus and salad are my other favorites.

N3LrRyBXhveB52aqDHgeAg.text: My friend introduced me to this Greek yumminess!  I'm so sad I no longer work across the street because I miss getting lunch here!! The lentil soup is yummy along with everything I've tried!! The staff is very kind and it's very clean! I will definitely be stopping by when I'm on that side of town!

Dq958ZyEP0Slp_-qcmFvhA.text: It took me awhile to try this place. The strip mall storefront doesn't draw you in but what a great spot. It is frequently on my lunch rotation. The food is healthy and full of flavor, portions are large and reasonably priced, lots of choices and the service is fast. The staff is always pleasant. The only minus is everyone Hi has figured out how great this little place is. It would be nice if they had a line to pick up to go phone orders. Glad to see another successful small business.

1yW_bb-Pd4TPafG1YxgmcQ.text: Ordered the combo plate with chicken schawarma and gyro. Chicken was ok and gyro meat was good. What really thru me off was when I ask for spicy sauce or the chilli paste your normally get with gyro places all they had was buffalo sauce and siracha which didn't go well with this kind of food.

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Combo plate. Chicken schawarma and gyro meat

3IilEUIwOvz9wt9LM7FACQ.text: This place is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! King of Gyros has the best taste of Mediterranean this side of the globe. I eat there often for lunch, so naturally when I hosted a Mediterranean themed party of 60, they were my first and only choice.  The food is always seasoned perfectly, the pita is always soft the way I like it.  Their hummus is amazing and they honestly have the best pistachio baklava I've ever tasted.   This is a family owned business and it's run like a well oiled machine!

WmFrakwTyB1roPr5fZHpkw.text: The best spot for gyros, Greek fires, and lentils soup! The owner and his family are very friendly! Our family loves coming here. Thank you king of gyros

CJag7tw7dGbHsiNnkEluRQ.text: This Greek fast casual restaurant is right down the street from my gym so we stop here once in a while when we need a quick dinner after working out. The food is pretty decent. A lot of the meats seem to be cooked ahead of time and then reheated but I guess that is what you have to do in order to get it out fast. Their pita bread is always soft and warm and tastes like it was fresh baked in house. Unfortunately I am in the middle of a gluten free experiment so I can't partake in any of that right now. But I am happy that almost any meat on the menu can be ordered in salad form. I am pretty picky about salad dressings but I love the house Greek dressing. So lemony! Yum! The salad base is romaine lettuce but they also include a bunch of other fresh veggies like bell pepper, onion, tomato, cucumber as well as feta and kalamata olives.  Most of the people working there are college age kids but they all are really courteous. We have always gotten great service. Last night we were there right as they were closing (8pm) but they still went out of their way to make sure we got everything we needed for our take out order. They also have sort of a Chicago theme going on so we got to catch part of the Bears preseason game while we waited.

pfTV4KNVjgPfEO8WxNqKfQ.text: Good lunch spot (gets crowded).  Chicken Shawarma is top-notch.  Only complaint is that it is always cold in there (door open + fans blowing on cool day).

photos.caption: Photo of King of Gyros - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Shawarma

ZjDonw4uRtNtWfn-Uhe1FA.text: So disappointed. Their food reminds me of airport food. Not made fresh and overpriced. Not coming back.

iY9SIKTfTC8Juw2t45BknQ.text: Fast service, good gyro! Stopped in for a quick lunch in a break from a workshop. Got 10% for checking in so that's awesome

u4oGouzXeoIOI7bDaJHjzA.text: !!! YAS YAS YAS!! For much less than I normally spend on lonely take-out hotel meals I ate like queen. I got a plate with gyro and falafel, fries, salad- all of which includes a drink for like $10.  I added on dolmas for good measure. The staff worked away in the open kitchen, still looking jovial and busy even 15 mins before close. There were so many little things that impressed me like, y'all- they have really good iced tea options! And little plastic containers so you can help yourself to accoutrements, cause you should fetch your own ketchup like an adult.   Anyways, totes bomb! Highly recommend it!

zajRjRXV2RwdCGgUE7Ut0w.text: Hands down my favorite genuine Chicago style fast food joint in Valley. I work in Chandler and hit this place at least once a week. On the weekends we drive all the way from North Scottsdale just get a gyros. Consistently great everyday. The owners who are from Chicago are there every time I stop in. It is a family owned and operated well oiled machine. I would give it more stars if they would let me.

-nuISnMzfYDOBU0hUGMmyA.text: Great place, quick service. I've eaten here 3 or 4 times and have taken out over a dozen times. Try the 2 meat combo plate.

kWZBI8t-AoktGRFodUnA-w.text: The Greek fries were amazing!! The green sauce served with the fries was delicious. The Greek salad is very good, served with the same green sauce.

HbPH0oaBUm_b2MXqd6NHhw.text: Did not like, King of Gyros. Food was very dry, are maybe I pick the wrong day to go. HOPEFULLY

Qhvi_Q6EYXBd4gutyr5GhA.text: My expectations were high and they definitely delivered! I got The sampler platter which comes with three meats,  salad and1 side.  I got steak, shawarma, and chicken souvlaki with hummus. The pizza rolls it came with were a nice accompaniment along with the tziki sauce

6xeH01j9aiRssf15UMKsDQ.text: Our last night in town and decided to try this little place. I ordered the appetizer sampler, subbing baba ghanoush for tabouleh. Husband had beef souvlaki with a Greek salad. There was a bit of miscommunication with the cashier that resulted in hubby being served chicken instead of beef, but the owner/manager guy quickly apologized and brought him the correct order. Food tasted great. I really enjoyed the hummus and tabouleh. The falafel was also good, and the dolmas came in last for my personal preference. I've just never been a big fan of them. The tzaziki sauce was tasty and went well with everything. Husband really enjoyed his beef dish and we both made sure to thank the staff for quickly fixing the original issue and giving such a nice flavorful meal. Overall I'd go back again!

QkrSxOmYj56lz7ENrey1aQ.text: Want to try some authentic Mediterranean  food this is the place to be. Very friendly staff and amazing food. Restaurant is family owned so they make sure you are happy with your food. It tried the number 8 chicken wrap it is so good! You also need to try the hummus it taste amazing!!!

LuqXeROI6OzLwWzauLIQjQ.text: Possibly the best gyro and Greek salad I've ever had. Everything here looks great. Especially the crinkle cut Fries

HKsSGogEWLRAvcYNG7y9KA.text: Good gyros & gyro platters...the lentil soup was delicious but the kids' menu left a bit to be desired.

3ESpJaCcNsE9Aq9gwvlp5Q.text: Always love coming to this place because the portions are huge, affordable, and I always leave very full and satisfied. The food has remained consistent in its delicious flavors every single time I've been back here and I never have any compliments even trying something new every time. The owner is super friendly and comes out to check on guests while they're eating which shows that they care and take pride in their business. I love this place and it has become one of my favorites. I highly recommend checking them out if you haven't already. (:

lvP1a-5Jmszt72fOAcz8uQ.text: Best gyro shop I've been to out of the dozens I've visited over the years. They have the best quality and quantity here. I get my gyro salad firefighter style with hot giardiniera. I recommend ordering before you go during lunch hour, it's a bit of a wait usually. That's my only complaint

CnUV2eNqnub9vwMJbEh3Sg.text: There is nothing on the menu here that isn't good. Their souvlaki chicken and chicken shawarma is the best I've had, super juicy and flavorful. They also use the "Greek" style pitas with everything! One of our favorite and usual dinner spots

RdKjVv5T3GP6pSbS5U1y1Q.text: Had the shawarma plate with rice and, with a suggestion from the employee, the lentil soup. Everything was great! Good portions, good flavor, good prices, and I especially loved that soup!

YAeadXsDSwyjNWUSTzAyng.text: We decided to try King of Gyros while we were down that way. I found it just great. My wife and I commented it was like a restaurant we went to in the past and no longer exist. Any time I an in that area they can count on my business. It is simple clean and the tables were not crowded. And most of all the food was good.
